xml.p: Rainy_Day_0: It's raining outside. Make sure you don't catch cold, dear.#$e#Stay indoors as much as possible.$h#$e#I worry about you sometimes! #!String
Rainy_Day_1: It's raining! That means we don't have to water the crops today.$h#$e#Nature can be a big help sometimes.#$e#Have you fed the animals yet, honey? #!String
Rainy_Day_2: Good morning! I woke up early from the sound of the rain and made you some breakfast. [194 195 210 211 216] #$e#Stay warm and don't work too hard. I want you to stay healthy. #!String
Rainy_Day_3: What's on your agenda today, dear?#$e#I don't want to go outside in this weather... I'll just do some things around the house.#$e#Maybe I'll make something hot for dinner. #!String
Rainy_Day_4: Any dinner requests for tonight? #!String
Rainy_Day_Maru: Despite all the technology we have, a rainy day is still the best tool for watering crops. #!String
Rainy_Day_Abigail: The countryside looks more interesting on a day like this, don't you think? #!String
Rainy_Day_Penny: I think I might do some baking today.$h #!String
Rainy_Day_Leah: Might want to do some fishing or mining today, huh? #!String
Rainy_Day_Haley: Hmmph. If this weather keeps up I'll get too pale.$s #!String
Rainy_Day_Harvey: Make sure you stay dry today, dear. I don't want you to become hypothermic. #!String
Rainy_Day_Sebastian: I got up just before dawn and took a walk around the farm. It's really peaceful at that hour. #!String
Rainy_Day_Alex: Hmm... I guess I'll have to do push-ups and sit-ups indoors today. #!String
Rainy_Day_Elliott: The rain makes me think of my old life by the ocean.#$e#Change is part of life. That's okay. #!String
Rainy_Day_Sam: I might spend some time today fixing any leaks in the roof or the windows. #!String
Rainy_Day_Emily: I know you pride yourself on your work, but don't overdo it today. Okay, honey?$u #!String
Rainy_Day_Shane: The roof's leaking? Ah well... a little mold never hurt anyone. #!String
Rainy_Night_0: The rain makes it feel like we're all alone.$l#$e#I'm cold... Aren't you ready to tuck into bed?$l #!String
Rainy_Night_1: Make sure you change into something warm. I don't want you to get sick.#$e#Can you hear the rain pattering on the roof, @? #!String
Rainy_Night_2: Ah...The soothing sound of rain overhead... I'm going to sleep well tonight.$h #!String
Rainy_Night_3: The rain makes our home seem so cozy.$h^It's nights like this I'm glad we have a quality roof. #!String
Rainy_Night_4: I made some soup for dinner. [199 218 219 727 730]$h#$e#You need something hot on a day like this!$h #!String
Rainy_Night_5: I'm glad you're home... It's a good night to stay inside. #!String
Rainy_Night_Maru: Were you able to accomplish much today, hun?#$e#I tried to fix up some things around the house... you know, just little stuff. #!String
Rainy_Night_Abigail: I'm ready to hop into bed whenever you are. The sound of rain will put us right to sleep. #!String
Rainy_Night_Penny: Oh... the smell? I tried to do some baking... It didn't work out too well.$s #!String
Rainy_Night_Leah: How was your day today, dear? Muddy? #!String
Rainy_Night_Haley: Hi, honey. I'm so glad you're home. I was starting to get kind of lonely.$l #!String
Rainy_Night_Harvey: Hi. It's good to see you.$h#$e#I spent the day skimming through some medical journals. #!String
Rainy_Night_Sebastian: I'll never grow tired of the rain... especially out here in the countryside. #!String
Rainy_Night_Alex: Grandma always used to make hot stew on nights like this.$h #!String
Rainy_Night_Elliott: Sit down, relax! You've got to be tired after trudging through the mud all day. #!String
Rainy_Night_Sam: Vincent called. He said he misses me and also to tell you hi.$h #!String
Rainy_Night_Shane: I just got off the phone with Jas and Marnie. They seem to be having a pretty good time without me. #!String
Rainy_Night_Emily: Certain spirits only appear in the rain. Maybe you've heard their cries? #!String
Indoor_Day_0: Good morning ~<$h#$e#Ready for a hard day's work? I am.$h #!String
Indoor_Day_1: Hi, honey! Smells good, doesn't it? I made you breakfast! [194 195 210 211 216]#$e#You need food to stay energized throughout the day. #!String
Indoor_Day_2: Did you sleep well?#$e#I've got some chores to do in here. #!String

Indoor_Day_3: Did you have any strange dreams last night?#$e#I did, but all I remember is that it had something to do with a %adj %noun. Weird.$s#$e#Hehe. Dreams don't mean anything... do they, Honey?$l#$e#Well, we can't spend all day chit-chatting. You have work to do! #!String
Indoor_Day_4: Good morning, dear. Another day of farm chores, huh?#$e#I'll be cheering for you. <$h #!String
Indoor_Day_Maru: If you ever want to talk about how to maximize crop yield or anything... I'm open to that! #!String
Indoor_Day_Abigail: There's always something new happening on our farm... I love it. #!String
Indoor_Day_Penny: This place is so big compared to the trailer, I feel overwhelmed... In a good way! #!String
Indoor_Day_Leah: Mind if I add some architectural flair to the woodwork around here? My chisel hand is itching! #!String
Indoor_Day_Haley: I always feel happy on a sunny day.$h #!String
Indoor_Day_Harvey: The sky looks great today... so clear!#$e#From now on, I'm only going to go into the clinic when I have appointments. Otherwise I can just work from home! #!String
Indoor_Day_Sebastian: Well, this place sure beats my old basement room, doesn't it?$h #!String
Indoor_Day_Alex: The sun's shining and I'm bursting with energy! You'd better watch out! Heh Heh.$h #!String

Indoor_Day_Elliott: I've been keeping a journal ever since we moved in together. Now that I actually have a life, I have lots to write about.$h#$e#I want to make sure I always remember these years. #!String
Indoor_Day_Sam: There's too much stuff I want to get done today... Maybe I'll just watch TV instead. #!String
Indoor_Day_Emily: By providing fresh, healthy produce to the community, we're doing a great service! #!String
Indoor_Day_Shane: There's something special in the air... *sniff*... what is that? Oh...#$b#It's just this old corn chip I put in my pocket a few weeks ago. *crunch* #!String
Indoor_Night_0: Did you get everything done today, @?#$e#I did some house chores... but now I'm so tired.#$e#I'm ready for bed whenever you are.$h #!String
Indoor_Night_1: Wow, you look like you did a lot of work today.#$e#Now you should just relax and kick back for the night.$h #!String
Indoor_Night_2: I'm glad you're home.#$e#I get kind of scared alone at night.$s^I get lonely at night...$s#$e#...$h #!String
Indoor_Night_3: Are you done with your work for the day? I'm ready to have some fun.$h#$e#But if you're tired I understand. #!String
Indoor_Night_4: *phew*! I just finished my chores. Now we can spend some time together.$h#$e#So, tell me about your day.$l#$e#...$h #!String
Indoor_Night_Maru: You look like you're ready for bed, @. Should I lull you to sleep with the technical details of my latest project?$h#$e#*yawn*... To be honest, I'm kind of sleepy too. #!String
Indoor_Night_Abigail: Are you ready for bed soon? I turned on the electric blanket for us...$l #!String
Indoor_Night_Penny: Hi there, honey. Ready to spend a quiet evening at home? #!String
Indoor_Night_Leah: It's so quiet and peaceful in the evening. Nothing to distract you from the experience of living. #!String
Indoor_Night_Haley: You look like you've been working hard, dear. Let me help you de-stress.$l #!String
Indoor_Night_Harvey: You look like you could use a good massage tonight.$l#$e#Doctor's orders... It's good for the circulation! #!String
Indoor_Night_Sebastian: #$c .5#I may be a reclusive guy, but I'm always happy when you're around.$h#$e#Hi, @. Good to see you. It's comforting when you're around.$h #!String
Indoor_Night_Alex: My arms feel a little restless... How about a nice, deep massage?$l^I feel exhausted... That's a good sign! It means I worked hard enough today.$h #!String

Indoor_Night_Elliott: #$c .5#You always smell so good after a day of hard work. It's your natural musk!^You smell sweet, my dear. Like a honeycomb drifting on a pool of spice tea.#$e#Come here, let me massage your back. You look tense.$l^You smell sweet, my dear. Like a cinnamon leaf floating in the summer breeze. #!String
Indoor_Night_Sam: #$c .5#I wonder if the moon is visible tonight?#$e#So, did you get everything done on the farm today? If you didn't I won't be mad! #!String
Indoor_Night_Emily: It's a very cozy house... I like it. #!String
Indoor_Night_Shane: How was your day? Mine actually went pretty well. #!String
Outdoor_0: It's a beautiful day today, isn't it?$h#$e#Days like this make work a little more pleasant. #!String
Outdoor_1: I'm just going to relax and inspect the farm today, okay?#$e#It's just such a nice-looking area.$h #!String
Outdoor_2: Hi, honey! If I knew more about farm work I'd help you out more. Sorry!#$e#I'll be thinking of you.$h #!String
Outdoor_3: I'm just going to do some dusting over here. That should help you out, right?#$e#*phew*... it's hot out here. #!String
Outdoor_4: Don't overwork yourself, dear.#$e#Make sure and take a break every now and then, or get something to eat.$h #!String
Outdoor_Maru: I like being out here. It's a good place to think about new inventions.$h#$e#I'm still hoping to come up with something to help you out in your work. #!String
Outdoor_Abigail: I'm just going to hang out here, okay?#$e#There's a lot of interesting bugs and things out here. *chuckle*$h #!String
Outdoor_Haley: Looks like a good day to work on my tan, don't you think, sweetheart?$h #!String
Outdoor_Leah: Wow, this is great! I'm really starting to enjoy life on the farm, @.$h#$e#This is the life I've always dreamed of.$l #!String
Outdoor_Penny: I'm really happy on our little farm, @.$h #!String
Outdoor_Sebastian: This is so different from my old life, but I'm really starting to like it.$h#$e#I feel like I really belong here.$l #!String
Outdoor_Harvey: This is so much nicer than being cooped up in the clinic all day.$l#$e#I love watching you on the farm... hehe #!String
Outdoor_Elliott: Today, I'm going to continue writing my new novel. What better place than our wonderful farm?$h#$e#This is perfect.$l #!String
Outdoor_Alex: I'm going to get a bunch of exercise today! Haha! I love living on a farm.$h #!String
Outdoor_Sam: Hey, look at those puffy clouds in the sky, honey!$h#$e#I'm going to watch those for a while, if you don't mind. #!String
Outdoor_Shane: I dunno if my lungs can handle this freshness. I'm still used to JojaAir. #!String
Outdoor_Emily: You're doing great work, @. Keep it up. #!String
jobLeave_Harvey: I have to go into the clinic today. Have a nice day, okay? #!String
jobLeave_Penny: I have to go into town today. Don't work too hard, and eat something good for lunch!$h #!String
jobLeave_Maru: I have to leave for work soon. I'll see you tonight. I'll be thinking of you!$h #!String
jobReturn_Harvey: #$c .5#Hi, honey. How was your day?#$e#*Phew*... I'm exhausted...$s#$e#My patients are still healthy, so it was a good day. #!String
jobReturn_Penny: #$c .5#Good evening. My day was fine, thanks! How was yours?$h#$e#Jas and Vincent weren't behaving very well today. I'm still all wound up... #!String

jobReturn_Maru: #$c .5#Well, it was just another boring day at the clinic.#$e#Hey. Did you have a more exciting day than me? I hope so.#$e#$c .5#Well, It's time to kick back and relax. Did you leave me any dinner?#$e#I'm just looking forward to bed-time.$h #!String
OneKid_0: Have you spent any time with %kid1 today? #!String
OneKid_1: I wonder if %kid1 will grow up to be a farmer like you? #!String
OneKid_2: Don't worry, I'll feed %kid1 today. You can just focus on running the farm. #!String
OneKid_3: Life's a lot different now that we have a child. #!String
TwoKids_0: I already gave %kid1 and %kid2 their breakfast. They were hungry! #!String
TwoKids_1: We have to make sure and give %kid1 a lot of attention now that we have %kid2. We don't want any jealousy between them. #!String
TwoKids_2: You know, I think %kid2 has your nose. #!String
TwoKids_3: A nice house, two wonderful kids, and a beautiful plot of land. What's left? #!String
Good_0: It's hard to believe we're finally married...$l #!String
Good_1: You know, I always had a feeling we'd be together some day.$l #!String
Good_2: Are you enjoying the married life, @?#$e#I am.$l #!String
Good_3: Wow, you look really handsome today!$l^Wow, you look beautiful today.$l #!String
Good_4: This place is my home now... I'm happy here.$l #!String
Good_5: I was just admiring my wedding amulet... The shell is flawless. It must have cost you a fortune!$l #!String
Good_6: Be careful out there! Sometimes I worry about you falling into a mine shaft. #!String
Good_7: @? I just want to say that I appreciate all the hard work you do for our household.$h #!String
Good_8: Don't worry about me... I know you've got a lot of responsibilities outside of the house. I'm fine in here by myself!$l #!String
Good_9: Oh, I'm not bored... I'm just enjoying what we have here.#$e#It's a simple life, but I like it.$h #!String
Neutral_0: I hope you'll still like me when I'm old and gray.$s #!String
Neutral_1: Do you think your grandpa would be proud of the work we've done? #!String
Neutral_2: Taking a break? I guess being a farmer is easier than I thought... #!String
Neutral_3: If you go into town, make sure and say hi to everyone for me. #!String
Neutral_4: I'll do the laundry tomorrow morning before you get up... that way you won't have any down-time. #!String
Neutral_5: Are we doing okay on money, @? #!String
Neutral_6: I wonder what everyone in town is doing today? #!String
Neutral_7: I don't really feel like doing anything today. #!String
Neutral_8: No matter how much I clean, the house keeps getting dirty again.#$e#I guess farms can be kind of dirty. #!String
Neutral_9: I wonder if we'll live here our entire lives? #!String
Bad_0: ...Do you still love me?$s #!String
Bad_1: *sigh*... Maybe we got married too young.$s #!String
Bad_2: Are you still happy with me?s #!String
Bad_3: Did I do something wrong? You've been acting different lately.$s #!String
Bad_4: Do you ever wonder what else is out there?$s #!String
Bad_5: You used to be romantic... what happened?$s#$e#I know I'm not as young as I used to be... is that what you married me for?$a #!String
Bad_6: We only have one short life to live... is this the best way to do it?$s #!String
Bad_7: I used to be your sweetie... now you only seem to put up with me when I make a hot dinner.$s #!String
Bad_8: You've been so cold to me lately...$s #!String
Bad_9: I wonder if I could've done better.$s #!String
spring_1: Well, a new year has arrived. Do you have a plan for what you want to accomplish this year?#$e#I feel pretty hopeful. #!String
spring_8: Now that winter's over, we've got lots of productive weather to look forward to. #!String
spring_23: I hope you've been practicing your moves... tomorrow is the flower dance! #!String
summer_1: Make sure you don't get a heat stroke, dear.#$e#Drink plenty of water and don't overwork yourself. #!String
summer_8: Sorry if I smell... I was sweating all night in the heat. #!String
summer_15: It's summer... that means the house is full of flies.#$e#Don't worry, I'll take care of them. #!String
fall_1: This weather feels pretty nice after the heat of summer. #!String
fall_8: Winter's just around the corner. We need to double check the heating system, turn off the valves, and check all the insulation in the house.#$e#Don't worry, I'll take care of it all. #!String
fall_15: Have you figured out what you're going to use for our grange display tomorrow? #!String
fall_26: Should we go to the Spirit's Eve festival tomorrow night? #!String
winter_1: Brrr.... It's cold. I guess winter has arrived. #!String
winter_7: Are you going to enter the fishing contest tomorrow? #!String
winter_28: Thanks for a great year, @. I'm excited to tackle next year together.$l #!String
spring_Maru: I'm feeling excited for a new year of farming, @!$h #!String
spring_Abigail: I may like the colder seasons, but by the end I'm always glad to see spring arrive. #!String
spring_Haley: Aren't you glad winter's over, honey? Things seem more hopeful now. #!String
spring_Leah: Don't forget to look for wild horseradish, leeks and dandelions while you're out there! #!String
spring_Penny: I'm so happy to see some greenery after that long white winter. #!String
spring_Sebastian: Wow, my skin is pale... I guess I'd better help you with some farm work this season. #!String
spring_Harvey: Let's plant some healthy vegetables this spring.$h #!String
spring_Elliott: I'm looking forward to a beautiful year on %farm farm.$h #!String
spring_Alex: Hey @. Let's work hard today! #!String
spring_Sam: *sniff* ... My doze is stubbed up... allergies. #!String
spring_Shane: Maybe I'll learn a new skill this year... #!String
summer_Maru: It's a good time of year to do some stargazing. #!String
summer_Abigail: Oh man... I could go for some chocolate cake. #!String
summer_Haley: You must know by now that summer is my favorite season.$h #!String
summer_Leah: Nothing pairs so well with summer like a nice sweet wine. Don't you think, honey? #!String
summer_Penny: Are you growing any melons this summer? #!String
summer_Sebastian: I'm going to stay inside as much as possible this summer. #!String
summer_Harvey: Make sure you don't get sunburnt, honey... That can really damage your skin. #!String
summer_Elliott: One of the main things I miss about the ocean is the fresh fish. #!String
summer_Alex: I always have the most energy in the summer. #!String
summer_Sam: Summer always makes me want to eat more barbecue. #!String
summer_Emily: Phew! It's hot but it feels great, doesn't it?#$e#Maybe we'll see some wild parrots today. #!String
summer_Shane: What's on my agenda today... hmmm... #$e#I think I see some spicy pretzel snacks and a couple of 'cold boys' on the horizon. #!String
fall_Maru: I'm glad I still work at the clinic... It's an important service for the community. #!String
fall_Abigail: I hope we're growing pumpkins this year.$h #!String
fall_Haley: I'm craving cake.#$e#But not just any cake... it has to be pink. #!String
fall_Leah: Breathe deep... can you smell that? That tells me it's mushroom season. #!String
fall_Penny: It's so peaceful out here on the farm. I never appreciated nature that much living in town. #!String
fall_Sebastian: My mother used to always make this delicious pumpkin soup in the fall. #!String
fall_Harvey: I could sure go for some wine. #!String
fall_Elliott: Ah... Fall. The warm sun drifts low in the sky, casting long shadows over waving fields of gold.#$e#It's a beautiful time of year, don't you think? #!String
fall_Alex: I feel weak... I need some protein.$s #!String
fall_Sam: I wonder what's going on in the rest of the world? We're really secluded here. #!String
fall_Emily: I drank a super-food smoothie this morning and I feel aaah-mazing!$h #!String
fall_Shane: I think there might be a new species of fungus growing behind my mini-fridge.#$e#Ah well, 'tis the season, right? #!String
winter_Maru: Spring is coming soon. I'm really looking forward to having rhubarb pie. #!String
winter_Abigail: Remember when we played that 'Prairie King' game together, in my room? Those were good times.$h #!String
winter_Haley: I was just thinking about the time you helped me open a jar of pickles.$h#$e#We've come a long way since then.$l #!String
winter_Leah: I always start craving salad in the winter... Inconvenient, I know. #!String
winter_Penny: I'm going to do a lot of reading this winter. #!String
winter_Sebastian: I wonder what Sam's up to? We used to be really good friends. #!String
winter_Harvey: Winter is flu season, so work is probably going to be a lot more stressful. Sorry in advance if I'm grouchy. #!String
winter_Elliott: I think I might do some writing this winter. There's not much else to do, anyway. #!String
winter_Alex: I hope my grandparents are doing okay. They used to rely on my help quite a bit. You know, with lifting heavy objects or whatever. #!String
winter_Sam: I've given up on being a musician. I'm a family man now! #!String
winter_Emily: Whoops, my hair is frozen solid again.$s #!String
winter_Shane: There's a wide, wide world out there... but I'd rather stay in my room. #!String
spouseRoom_Maru: #$c .5#I got up early to do a little star-gazing.#$e#I hope you don't mind if I spend some time on my projects today, honey. #!String
spouseRoom_Abigail: #$c .5#I got up a little before you and fed David Jr. He's very active this morning.#$e#I hope you don't mind the guinea pig smell. #!String
spouseRoom_Haley: #$c .5#Go ahead and start your day, honey. I'm just putting on my make-up.#$e#Have any plans for the day? #!String
spouseRoom_Leah: #$c .5#One of these days I'll have to do your portrait.#$e#The view from this window is inspiring, don't you think? #!String
spouseRoom_Penny: #$c .5#I always wanted my very own library. This is so charming.$h#$e#I like to do a little reading first thing in the morning. It gets my brain into gear. #!String
spouseRoom_Sebastian: #$c .5#I'm debating whether I should work or just read comics all day.#$e#Hey, do we have any pizza in the freezer? I'm hungry. #!String

spouseRoom_Harvey: #$c .5#No air-traffic this morning, honey. But it's still fun to break out the equipment now and then.#$e#I'm working on a new model plane. It's so much more relaxing here than in my old apartment. #!String
spouseRoom_Elliott: #$c .5#I think I might do some writing today.#$e#Will you be okay without my help? #!String
spouseRoom_Alex: #$c .5#Don't ever let me get lazy. I want to stay in good shape for you!#$e#There's lots of room here to do my exercises. I'm making more progress than ever! #!String
spouseRoom_Sam: #$c .5#The old guitar... I don't have as much drive to play it anymore. That's fine.#$e#What's on your agenda today? #!String
spouseRoom_Emily: I'm going to spend some time with the parrot today. It breaks my heart that he'll never fly again.$u #!String
spouseRoom_Shane: #$c .5#Beer or cider? Sometimes life can be challenging.#$e#Hi, @. I'll just hang out in here today and uh... maybe sweep the floor a little bit or something. #!String
Rainy_Day_Krobus: Ah, It's more humid today with the rain... I feel a lot more comfortable. #!String

Rainy_Night_Krobus: The sound of the rain reminds me of the sewers... it's comforting.#$e#The sewers were my refuge... I felt safe there. But don't worry... I feel the same way about my new home, too. #!String
Indoor_Day_Krobus: I wish I could help you on the farm, but I can't go out in the sun... #!String
Indoor_Night_Krobus: Hi, @. Welcome home. You look like you've been working hard out there!$h #!String
Outdoor_Krobus: On a day like this, I can enjoy the outdoors with you. This is really nice!$h#$b#Just let me know if you see anyone coming, so I can hide.$u #!String
NoBed_0: Where am I supposed to sleep...?$s #!String
NoBed_1: I wasn't able to sleep well last night...$s #!String
NoBed_2: I had to sleep on the floor last night...$s #!String
NoBed_3: Did something happen to our bed...?$s #!String
